articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: FIVE years ago today, Neil Lennon returned to the Celtic dug-out in the wake of Brendan Rodgers’ hasty exit for Leicester City. By a stroke of fortune, the Hoops legend had just quit his managerial post at Hibs the previous month and did not take too much persuasion to once again accept the challenge of [...]
articles.title: FIVE YEARS AGO: WELCOME BACK, LENNY

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: No one can convince you or I Celtic played well, against The ‘Well, yesterday.  Throughout the first half, the players looked like strangers.  At times, Motherwell ripped us open.  This was not league winning form.  None of that matters, though. When you are not playing well, all that matters is you pick up wins until [...]
articles.title: Turning points matter more than form

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS hailed his true grit champions after Celtic’s remarkable comeback against Motherwell at Fir Park. The Hoops went into the dramatic tussle five points behind in their quest to win their twelfth title in 13 years. At the interval, they were trailing by a Blair Spittal goal and looking miles off the pace with the [...]
articles.title: ‘I’M REALLY PROUD,’ RODGERS HAILS COMEBACK CHAMPIONS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC celebrated a 2-1 League Cup victory over Ibrox opposition at Hampden exactly a year ago today. The first piece of silverware of the season was claimed after Kyogo Furuhashi had fired a double behind Allan McGregor as Ange Postecoglou picked up his third honour in his short reign as Hoops manager. The previous season [...]
articles.title: ‘I COULDN’T BE HAPPIER,’ ANGE A YEAR AGO

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ON SATURDAY, May 26 2001, the sun beamed brightly on Hampden and Martin O’Neill as he brought down the curtain on his history-equalling first season as Celtic manager. Only the legendary Jock Stein had achieved the domestic clean sweep before in the Hoops’ history – and he did it twice, in seasons 1966/67 and 1968/69. [...]
articles.title: WELCOME TO PARADISE, MARTIN: PART FIVE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MOTHERWELL 1 CELTIC 3 BREATHTAKING! That’s the only word to describe a remarkable rousing second-half comeback from never-say-die Celtic at Fir Park this afternoon. The champions stumbled through a mistake-strewn opening half before clicking into top gear with a three-goal response to trailing at the interval. Adam Idah, who had come on for Kyogo Furuhashi [...]
articles.title: MOTHERWELL 1 CELTIC 3: IDAH AT THE DOUBLE AND PALMA STRIKE IN LATE, LATE SHOW

articles.description: Live updates will appear below after 12.00
articles.title: Motherwell v Celtic, Live updates

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC boss Brendan Rodgers has brought back Tomoki Iwata to face Motherwell in the midday kick-off at Fir Park this afternoon. The Japanese midfield anchorman comes in beside Callum McGregor and Matt O’Riley while Alistair Johnston also returns after injury to replace Anthony Ralston at right-back. Maik Nawrocki partners Liam Scales in central defence with the [...]
articles.title: CONFIRMED: IWATA, JOHNSTON RETURN IN CELTIC CHANGES

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: DO YOU ever feel the need to read something more than once to make sure your eyes aren’t deceiving you? Earlier today, I had to make sure my weary, old peepers hadn’t malfunctioned when I was scanning some Celtic reports. Admittedly, Sunday mornings can be dodgy territory for someone who may have over-indulged in firewater [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: DEATH IN PARADISE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has laid his demands on the line for his Celtic players as the title pressure ramps up. The champions take on Motherwell in a High Noon showdown at Fir Park today as they aim to respond to their nearest challengers’ 5-0 win over Hearts at Ibrox yesterday. The result in Govan sees the [...]
articles.title: ‘DEAL WITH IT’ – OR ‘GO AWAY’: RODGERS’ BLUNT MESSAGE TO PLAYERS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MARTIN O’NEILL was one triumph away from his first silverware success as Celtic manager when the Hoops faced Kilmarnock in the League Cup Final at Hampden on March 18, 2001. It was to turn out to be a dramatic confrontation – but one man stole the show with a breathtaking performance to make certain Irish eyes [...]
articles.title: WELCOME TO PARADISE, MARTIN: PART FOUR

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC relied on a dramatic stoppage-time foal from Matt O’Riley to secure a 2-1 victory and three points the last time the teams locked horns at Fir Park in September. Now Brendan Rodgers’ champions and Stuart Kettelwell’s side, who grabbed a point with a last-gasp equaliser at Parkhead in November, meet again today at the venue [...]
articles.title: MOTHERWELL v CELTIC: 5-MINUTE QUIZ

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Marco Tilio scored a spectacular equaliser which secured a draw for Melbourne City away to Sydney this morning.  His first touch, change of pace, drop of the shoulder and finish from 18 yards were all exceptional. It took 61 minutes for A-League viewers to see this from Marco, which is more than twice as much [...]
articles.title: Tilio is a player: the evidence mounts

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: “I DON’T ask that you adore me, “But, for God’s sake, please don’t ignore me.” Okay, not exactly poet laureate material, but I reckon it would be a fair epitaph for any self-respecting newspaper columnist. I admit to not being a devotee of Oscar Wilde during my formative years. Among the inhabitants of the Glasgow housing [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: HOW TO IRRITATE PEOPLE AND BE A SUCCESS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: PETER LAWWELL admits Celtic did not achieve their transfer ambitions in the January window as the champions attempted to strengthen the squad. Brendan Rodgers’ recruitment was limited to only two new faces – Nicolas Kuhn, the German winger who cost £3million from Rapid Vienna, and Republic of Ireland international striker Adam Idah, who joined on [...]
articles.title: ‘NEVER THE INTENTION,’ LAWWELL EXPLAINS TRANSFER FRUSTRATION

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MARTIN O’NEILL stormed through his first Premier League campaign as Celtic manager by guiding the team to the title with a total of 97 points – FIFTEEN ahead of also-rans Rangers. The Hoops, in fact, took their eye off the ball when they lost their last two league games against Dundee and Kilmarnock when the [...]
articles.title: WELCOME TO PARADISE, MARTIN: PART THREE

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Celtic released their interim financial statement for the six months to 31 December 2023 this afternoon.  They will doubtlessly stun and frustrate you in equal measure.  Revenue for the first half of a season reached a new high of £85.2m (2022: £76.5m). Pretax profit for the period was £30.302m, down slightly on the 2022 figure [...]
articles.title: Interims will stun and frustrate

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS insists Celtic can only blame themselves for their topple from the Premiership pinnacle. The champions conceded pole position for the first time since February 2 2022 after drawing with Kilmarnock at Parkhead at the weekend while their nearest challengers from Ibrox overcame St Johnstone in Perth. The Hoops are now two points adrift with [...]
articles.title: ‘WE HAVE TO LEARN,’ RODGERS REFLECTS ON SETBACKS

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Joe Hart’s first job when he arrived at Celtic was to provide stability where it was sorely missing the previous season.  Vasilis Barkas started the season in goal and played 22 games in total, he was dropped for Scott Bain, who made 23 appearances, but both gave way for Conor Hazard, who played six times, [...]
articles.title: Joe the Stabiliser. Motherwell the unpredictable

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BENJI SIEGRIST is in danger of becoming one of football’s great underachievers. The towering Celtic stand-by keeper hasn’t figured in the first team this season and has dropped to third in the pecking order in Brendan Rodgers’ matchday squad. Joe Hart has been a fixture at No.1 while Scott Bain got the nod to stand [...]
articles.title: ‘UNDERACHIEVER’ COULD SOLVE CELTIC’S No.1 PROBLEM

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NEIL LENNON departed Celtic exactly THREE years ago today as the champions’ dream of an unprecedented tenth successive title headed for wretched failure. It was all over for the under-pressure manager on a fateful day, only 48 hours after an excruciating and inexplicable 1-0 loss to relegation-threatened Ross County in Dingwall. It proved a defeat too [...]
articles.title: THREE YEARS AGO: LENNY EXIT AND THE END OF A DREAM

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MARTIN O’NEILL wasn’t slow to splash the cash as he made his entrance at Celtic in preparation for the 2000/01 campaign. Today, in Part Two of CQN’s EXCLUSIVE extracts from Alex Gordon’s publication, ‘CELTIC: The History Bhoys‘, we look at how the Irishman settled in so quickly to the Parkhead dug-out.
